definition[0]: someone who deals with the instructions in someone’s will
definition[1]: a person, lawyer, or bank that deals with the instructions in someone’s WILL (=a document that says who should receive their property after they die)
example[0]: His executors hope that the money raised by the painting will pay off the last of his debts.
example[1]: The major banks now provide insurance, security-dealing, trustee and executor services.
